title: High-flying fun at Kuranda
text:
High-flying fun at Kuranda festival near Cairns this weekend by: What are these? SHOW TIME: Clown Danny Simony, flame and knife throwers Jacob and Sophie McGrath and ringmaster Marc Sleeman will be part of the fun. PICTURE: JUSTIN BRIERTY Source: News Limited 
FIRE manipulation, flipping acrobats and a high-flying aerialist will help turn Kuranda into an outdoor big top when Dream State Circus comes to the town on Sunday. 
Young budding circus performers will be able to learn skills including stilt walking, uni-cycling, diabolos, poi, plates, fire twirling, juggling, hula hoops, acro-balance, clowning, aerial and much more. 
Tourism Kuranda executive officer Marc Sleeman said the circus would be just one part of a packed program. 
“There will be free jumping castles, face painters, a magic show, horse-and-carriage rides, mini golf, art displays and lolly-making demonstrations plus activities all over the village from the two markets to Centenary Park, to the main street and down to the Barron River,” he said. 
“This year we are looking for contestants for the inaugural Croc Swim, a dash across the Barron River where we have a resident population of freshwater crocodiles, before teams battle it out for the Bash of the Barron River Raft Race.’’ 
Kuranda Festival will this year help celebrate the 127th anniversary of the official survey of the town. 
As part of the event, Kuranda Scenic Railway is offering a 50 per cent locals’ discount for travel on Sunday, October 18. Conditions apply.
